content: I was looking into the CSS and notied that .app-main has max-width: 1400px; Is there a reason for that? I mean, does it cause issues on some devices if that is removed?

@Alex the intent is to prevent the message section from becoming ultra-wide, since that reduces readability. You can see similar limits on text content width in other websites optimized for reading content, like GitHub and Medium.

It's an interesting decision but also sort of a curious one. Probably the main issue is that on a wide-ish screen, the people icon is removed and the user list is shown by default. If there is an advantage to the narrow chat - and I think that's sort of debatable - it is negated by the list of users on the right. Not really useful to see a list of users unless you are looking for someone.
